# Lazea (BNR): Without those fiscal consolidation measures we would have talked about an insolvent Romania

Friday, January 30, 2026

[Share](http://www.addtoany.com/share_save)

Without the fiscal consolidation measures adopted in the past months, Romania would have been faced by insolvency, downgraded to the “junk” category and the impossibility to finance pensions and salaries without printing money, said Valentin Lazea, the chief economist of the National Bank of Romania (BNR), in the article “About honesty in economic debate,” posted on Opiniibnr.ro.

“We will conclude this article with an example of lack of honesty: the harsh criticism made against Bolojan's Government in the last 6 months for having affected consumption and economic growth with the measures of fiscal consolidation adopted. The truth is that, without those measures of fiscal consolidation we would have talked about an insolvent Romania, downgraded to the junk category by rating agencies, incapable of paying pensions and salaries other than by printing money.
